Source code for src.vectorstore_faiss.gpu

  1"""Overview of gpu.
  2
  3This module bundles gpu logic for the kgfoundry stack. It groups related helpers so downstream
  4packages can import a single cohesive namespace. Refer to the functions and classes below for
  5implementation specifics.
  6"""
  7
  8from __future__ import annotations
  9
 10import os
 11from typing import Any, Final, TypeAlias, cast
 12
 13import numpy as np
 14from numpy.typing import NDArray
 15
 16from kgfoundry_common.navmap_types import NavMap
 17
 18__all__ = ["FaissGpuIndex", "FloatArray", "IntArray", "StrArray"]
 19

 26            "id": "public-api",
 27            "title": "Public API",

 57class FaissGpuIndex:
 58    """Model the FaissGpuIndex.
 59
 60    Represent the faissgpuindex data structure used throughout the project. The class encapsulates
 61    behaviour behind a well-defined interface for collaborating components. Instances are typically
 62    created by factories or runtime orchestrators documented nearby.
 63    """
 64
 65    def __init__(
 66        self,
 67        factory: str = "OPQ64,IVF8192,PQ64",
 68        nprobe: int = 64,
 69        gpu: bool = True,
 70        cuvs: bool = True,
 71    ) -> None:
 72        """Compute init.
 73
 74        Initialise a new instance with validated parameters. The constructor prepares internal state and coordinates any setup required by the class. Subclasses should call ``super().__init__`` to keep validation and defaults intact.
 75
 76        Parameters
 77        ----------
 78        factory : str | None
 79            Optional parameter default ``'OPQ64,IVF8192,PQ64'``. Description for ``factory``.
 80        nprobe : int | None
 81            Optional parameter default ``64``. Description for ``nprobe``.
 82        gpu : bool | None
 83            Optional parameter default ``True``. Description for ``gpu``.
 84        cuvs : bool | None
 85            Optional parameter default ``True``. Description for ``cuvs``.
 86        """
 87


[docs]
 88        self.factory = factory




[docs]
 89        self.nprobe = nprobe




[docs]
 90        self.gpu = gpu




[docs]
 91        self.cuvs = cuvs




[docs]
 92        self._faiss: Any | None = None




[docs]
 93        self._res: Any | None = None




[docs]
 94        self._index: Any | None = None




[docs]
 95        self._idmap: StrArray | None = None




[docs]
 96        self._xb: FloatArray | None = None


 97        try:
 98            import faiss
 99
100            self._faiss = faiss
101        except Exception:  # pragma: no cover - environment without FAISS
102            self._faiss = None
103


[docs]
104    def _ensure_resources(self) -> None:
105        """Compute ensure resources.
106
107        Carry out the ensure resources operation.
108        """
109        if not self._faiss or not self.gpu:
110            return
111        if self._res is None:
112            faiss = self._faiss
113            self._res = faiss.StandardGpuResources()


114


[docs]
115    def train(self, train_vectors: FloatArray, *, seed: int = 42) -> None:
116        """Compute train.
117
118        Carry out the train operation for the surrounding component. Generated documentation highlights how this helper collaborates with neighbouring utilities. Callers rely on the routine to remain stable across releases.
119        
120        Parameters
121        ----------
122        train_vectors : src.vectorstore_faiss.gpu.FloatArray
123            Description for ``train_vectors``.
124        seed : int | None
125            Optional parameter default ``42``. Description for ``seed``.
126        
127        Examples
128        --------
129        >>> from vectorstore_faiss.gpu import train
130        >>> train(...)  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
131        """
132
133        if self._faiss is None:
134            return
135        train_mat = cast(FloatArray, np.asarray(train_vectors, dtype=np.float32, order="C"))
136        faiss = self._faiss
137        dimension = train_mat.shape[1]
138        cpu_index = faiss.index_factory(dimension, self.factory, faiss.METRIC_INNER_PRODUCT)
139        faiss.normalize_L2(train_mat)
140        cpu_index.train(train_mat)
141        self._ensure_resources()
142        if self.gpu:
143            options = faiss.GpuClonerOptions()
144            if hasattr(options, "use_cuvs"):
145                options.use_cuvs = bool(self.cuvs)
146            try:
147                self._index = faiss.index_cpu_to_gpu(self._res, 0, cpu_index, options)
148            except Exception:  # pragma: no cover - fallback without cuVS
149                self._index = faiss.index_cpu_to_gpu(self._res, 0, cpu_index)
150        else:
151            self._index = cpu_index
152        try:
153            params = faiss.GpuParameterSpace() if self.gpu else faiss.ParameterSpace()
154            params.set_index_parameter(self._index, "nprobe", self.nprobe)
155        except Exception:
156            pass


157


[docs]
158    def add(self, keys: list[str], vectors: FloatArray) -> None:
159        """Compute add.
160
161        Carry out the add operation for the surrounding component. Generated documentation highlights how this helper collaborates with neighbouring utilities. Callers rely on the routine to remain stable across releases.
162        
163        Parameters
164        ----------
165        keys : List[str]
166            Description for ``keys``.
167        vectors : src.vectorstore_faiss.gpu.FloatArray
168            Description for ``vectors``.
169        
170        Raises
171        ------
172        RuntimeError
173            Raised when validation fails.
174        
175        Examples
176        --------
177        >>> from vectorstore_faiss.gpu import add
178        >>> add(..., ...)  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
179        """
180
181        vec_array = cast(FloatArray, np.asarray(vectors, dtype=np.float32, order="C"))
182        if self._faiss is None:
183            self._xb = cast(FloatArray, np.array(vec_array, copy=True))
184            self._idmap = cast(StrArray, np.asarray(keys, dtype=str))
185            norms = np.linalg.norm(self._xb, axis=1, keepdims=True) + 1e-12
186            self._xb /= norms
187            return
188        faiss = self._faiss
189        if self._index is None:
190            message = "FAISS index not initialized; call train() before add()."
191            raise RuntimeError(message)
192        faiss.normalize_L2(vec_array)
193        if isinstance(self._index, faiss.IndexIDMap2):
194            idmap_array = cast(IntArray, np.asarray(keys, dtype="int64"))
195            self._index.add_with_ids(vec_array, idmap_array)
196        elif hasattr(faiss, "IndexIDMap2"):
197            idmap = faiss.IndexIDMap2(self._index)
198            idmap_array = cast(IntArray, np.asarray(keys, dtype="int64"))
199            idmap.add_with_ids(vec_array, idmap_array)
200            self._index = idmap
201        else:
202            self._index.add(vec_array)


203


[docs]
204    def search(self, query: FloatArray, k: int) -> list[tuple[str, float]]:
205        """Compute search.
206
207        Carry out the search operation for the surrounding component. Generated documentation highlights how this helper collaborates with neighbouring utilities. Callers rely on the routine to remain stable across releases.
208        
209        Parameters
210        ----------
211        query : src.vectorstore_faiss.gpu.FloatArray
212            Description for ``query``.
213        k : int
214            Description for ``k``.
215        
216        Returns
217        -------
218        List[Tuple[str, float]]
219            Description of return value.
220        
221        Raises
222        ------
223        RuntimeError
224            Raised when validation fails.
225        
226        Examples
227        --------
228        >>> from vectorstore_faiss.gpu import search
229        >>> result = search(..., ...)
230        >>> result  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
231        ...
232        """
233
234        q = cast(FloatArray, np.asarray(query, dtype=np.float32, order="C"))
235        q /= np.linalg.norm(q, axis=-1, keepdims=True) + 1e-12
236        if self._faiss is None or self._index is None:
237            if self._xb is None or self._idmap is None:
238                return []
239            sims_matrix = self._xb @ q.T
240            sims = np.asarray(sims_matrix, dtype=np.float32).squeeze()
241            indices = np.argsort(-sims)[:k]
242            return [(str(self._idmap[i]), float(sims[i])) for i in indices.tolist()]
243        if self._idmap is None:
244            message = "ID map not loaded; cannot resolve FAISS results."
245            raise RuntimeError(message)
246        distances, indices = self._index.search(q.reshape(1, -1), k)
247        ids = indices[0]
248        scores = distances[0]
249        return [(str(ids[i]), float(scores[i])) for i in range(len(ids)) if ids[i] != -1]


250


[docs]
251    def save(self, index_uri: str, idmap_uri: str | None = None) -> None:
252        """Compute save.
253
254        Carry out the save operation for the surrounding component. Generated documentation highlights how this helper collaborates with neighbouring utilities. Callers rely on the routine to remain stable across releases.
255        
256        Parameters
257        ----------
258        index_uri : str
259            Description for ``index_uri``.
260        idmap_uri : str | None
261            Optional parameter default ``None``. Description for ``idmap_uri``.
262        
263        Raises
264        ------
265        RuntimeError
266            Raised when validation fails.
267        
268        Examples
269        --------
270        >>> from vectorstore_faiss.gpu import save
271        >>> save(...)  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
272        """
273
274        if self._faiss is None or self._index is None:
275            if self._xb is not None and self._idmap is not None:
276                np.savez(index_uri, xb=self._xb, ids=self._idmap)
277            return
278        faiss = self._faiss
279        if faiss is None:
280            message = "FAISS not available"
281            raise RuntimeError(message)
282        target_index = faiss.index_gpu_to_cpu(self._index) if self.gpu else self._index
283        faiss.write_index(target_index, index_uri)


284


[docs]
285    def load(self, index_uri: str, idmap_uri: str | None = None) -> None:
286        """Compute load.
287
288        Carry out the load operation for the surrounding component. Generated documentation highlights how this helper collaborates with neighbouring utilities. Callers rely on the routine to remain stable across releases.
289        
290        Parameters
291        ----------
292        index_uri : str
293            Description for ``index_uri``.
294        idmap_uri : str | None
295            Optional parameter default ``None``. Description for ``idmap_uri``.
296        
297        Raises
298        ------
299        RuntimeError
300            Raised when validation fails.
301        
302        Examples
303        --------
304        >>> from vectorstore_faiss.gpu import load
305        >>> load(...)  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
306        """
307
308        if self._faiss is None:
309            if os.path.exists(index_uri + ".npz"):
310                data = np.load(index_uri + ".npz", allow_pickle=True)
311                self._xb = data["xb"]
312                self._idmap = data["ids"]
313            return
314        faiss = self._faiss
315        if faiss is None:
316            message = "FAISS not available"
317            raise RuntimeError(message)
318        cpu_index = faiss.read_index(index_uri)
319        self._ensure_resources()
320        if self.gpu:
321            options = faiss.GpuClonerOptions()
322            if hasattr(options, "use_cuvs"):
323                options.use_cuvs = bool(self.cuvs)
324            try:
325                self._index = faiss.index_cpu_to_gpu(self._res, 0, cpu_index, options)
326            except Exception:
327                self._index = faiss.index_cpu_to_gpu(self._res, 0, cpu_index)
328        else:
329            self._index = cpu_index
